content: so vanilla socks 2 0 by mary lukas this is the first of four patterns in my so vanilla socks series i originally wrote this back in 2016 and it s been downloaded over 20 000 times since i have corrected a mistake in the numbers for the short row heel i ve been knitting socks since i started knitting in 2007 since then i ve knit over 300 pairs of socks and i almost always go back to this specific recipe i ve knit socks both toe-up and cuff-down but i ve found to prefer toe-up toe-up sock knitting makes it easy to try on your socks at every stage of your knitting and you can knit to your preferred leg length or until you run out of yarn in this version i m going to teach you the recipe that i use when i knit toe-up socks using magic loop what you ll need 2 25mm us 1 circular knitting needles or size needed to get gauge i recommend at least 32 inch my preferred length you can substitute dpns and i ll show you how in the pattern notes 100 grams of fingering weight sock yarn stitch marker or locking stitch marker optional ruler or measuring tape darning needle gauge 8 5 stitches/inch using 2 25mm needles i normally include the fish lips kiss heel by sox therapist sizing when i m knitting vanilla socks and that s because it is an 1 2 3 - which fits around a foot circumference of 7 8 9 inches around easy and well-written heel pattern i do not normally use a short-row heel anymore it s highly worth the $1 investment important notes and i highly highly recommend it this pattern is written for magic loop but can easily be changed to dpns use 2 needles for n1 and another 2 for n2 © 2021 mary lukas || www purlkitty com || mary@purlkitty com || for personal use only || page 1 abbreviations the foot k-knit p-purl knit every row until your sock reaches the center of your ankle kfb - knit into the front of the stitch and again through bone when you try it on i find this is the perfect spot to put in a short row or fish lips kiss heel the back is increases one stitch sl slip your next stitch from the left to the right needle short row heel unless noted w&t wrap and turn bring the yarn to the front between if you prefer a narrower heel you can continue the short row for the needles slip the next stitch from the left needle to the another few row or if you need a wider heel work a few less right purlwise bring the yarn to the back between the row you re only going to be turning your heel over n2 needles slip the stitch from the right needle to the left turn your work row 1 - knit across
